com.safety4kids.game.Screens

Class Level1Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.safety4kids.game.Screens.GameScreen
      • com.safety4kids.game.Screens.Level1Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class Level1Screen
extends GameScreen
    This Class represents the first level of the game where it is based on an interactive learning platformer. Using Box2d bodies, tile maps, cameras, viewports, game loops, and game states to create a cohesive platformer meant to make the user learn about safety Most of the documentation for the methods used can be found at libgdx alongside the documentation used to make this game tilemap resources from by ansimuz Sprite resources are original from Erfan.Y and Bill.B

    Course info:

    ICS4U with V. Krasteva
    Author:
    Erfan Yeganehfar, Bill Bai

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level1Screen

        public Level1Screen(Safety4Kids game)
        The constructor creates all the necessary components for this specific platformer. This includes the actual game, the sprite batches, game camera, viewport, box2d world through the gameState. and the collision detection, main player, tileMaps, and Hud in this constructor.
        Parameters:
        game - The Safety4Kids Game that this level screen is displayed on

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(float dt)
        The update method used to update the locations and states of the game, it also changes how the camera is relative to the player
        Specified by:
        update in class GameScreen
        Parameters:
        dt - The target frame rate minus the time taken to complete this frame is called the delta time, used to keep the frames consistant across platforms

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        The renderer method updates and displays new graphical/technical changes to the game screen based on the game camera This includes the Tiled Map, the box2d debugger, the camera position, and the onscreen Hud.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Specified by:
        render in class GameScreen
        Parameters:
        delta - The target frame rate minus the time taken to complete this frame is called the delta time, used to keep the frames consistant across platforms

      • drawText

        public void drawText(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch,
                     float xPos)
        Based on the character's x-position on the map, this method will draw correct text. The text is composed of educational material that will teach the user of safety.
        Parameters:
        batch - The SpriteBatch to be drawn on.
        xPos - The character's x-position on the map.

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Based on the screen size, the viewport of the game is positioned to correctly display the game screen.
        Specified by:
        resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Specified by:
        resize in class GameScreen
        Parameters:
        width - the world width to be displayed.
        height - the world height to be displayed.
